joint.legend: Are you applying for a joint loan with your partner?

refugeeDate.label: What date were you granted refugee or humanitarian protection status?
refugeeDate.hint: You can find this date on your biometric residence permit (BRP).

niNumber.label: National Insurance number
niNumber.hint: You can find this on the back of your biometric residency permit (BRP). For example, ‘AB 12 34 56 C’.

homeOfficeReference.label: Home Office reference number
homeOfficeReference.hint: You can find this on your asylum application letter from the Home Office. It's sometimes called 'Case ID'. For example, ‘A1234567’.

incomeTypes.hint: Select all options that are relevant to you.

outgoingTypes.hint: Select all options that are relevant to you.

debts.hint: This includes universal credit advance payment, credit card debt and loans.

purposeTypes.hint: Select all options that are relevant to you.

housing.label: Housing
housing.hint: Deposit, rent payment or moving costs.

essential_items.label: Essential items
essential_items.hint: For example, furniture, fridge, curtains or carpets.

basic_living_costs.label: Basic living costs
basic_living_costs.hint: For example, food, household bills or travel within the UK.

bank_account.label: Bank account
bank_account.hint: You’ll already have a bank account open in your name.

aspen_card.label: ASPEN card
aspen_card.hint: You’ll have an ASPEN card and received Asylum support.

aspenNumber.label: ASPEN card number
aspenNumber.hint: This is a 12 digit number on the front of your ASPEN card.

accountNumber.label: Account number
accountNumber.hint: Must be between 6 and 8 digits long

rollNumber.label: Building society roll number (if you have one)
rollNumber.hint: You can find it on your card, statement or passbook

contactTypes.legend: We will need to contact you to let you know the result of your application.
contactTypes.hint: Select all options that are relevant to you.
